title: Walkthrough Tutorial: Divorce and Crime Analysis Package
text:
Introduction
This tutorial walks through how to install, use, and explore the Stat386 Divorce–Crime Analysis Package.
By the end of this tutorial, you will be able to:

Install the package from PyPI
Load and clean the crime and divorce datasets
Understand the structure of the data
Run and interact with the Streamlit application
Explore trends in crime and divorce over time




Package Overview
The package provides tools for:

Loading and wrangling FBI crime and divorce data
Aggregating monthly crime data to yearly summaries
Visualizing trends by state and crime type
Exploring relationships between crime and divorce rates

The primary user interface is an interactive Streamlit app.



Installation

Prerequisites

Python 3.9 or newer
pip installed



Install from PyPI
pip install stat386-finalproject-divorce-crime




Project Structure
After installation, the project contains:
Stat386-FinalProject-Divorce-Crime
├─ docs
|  ├─ documentation.qmd
|  └─ tutorial.qmd
├─ src
│  ├─ stat386_finalproject_divorce_crime
│  │  ├─ __init__.py
│  │  ├─ app.py                         # streamlit app
│  │  ├─ wrangling.py                   # loading and managing data
│  │  └─ clean_data.py                  # merges and cleans data
│  ├─ data
│  │  ├─ Combined_df.csv                # merged data
|  |  ├─ Marriage_Divorce_rates.csv     # marriage and divorce data
|  |  └─ summarized_fbi_data.parquet    # FBI Crime data
│  └─ json
│     └─ crime_abbr.json
├─ pyproject.toml
└─ README.md




Loading the Data
The package provides helper functions to load and prepare data.
from stat386_finalproject_divorce_crime.wrangling import load_data

df = load_data("Combined_df.csv")
df.head()


Running the Streamlit App
The easiest way to explore the data is through the Streamlit app. You can access it by running the following in a terminal.
streamlit run src/stat386_finalproject_divorce_crime/app.py
This launches an interactive dashboard in your browser.



Using the Streamlit Interface

Sidebar Controls
Users can select:

A state
A crime category
Metric type (Actual vs Rate)



Visualizations
The app displays:

Crime trends over time
Crime vs divorce comparisons for a single state
Dynamic updates based on user selections





Interpreting the Results
When exploring the plots, consider:

Long-term crime trends by state
Differences between crime counts and crime rates
How divorce trends change alongside crime over time
Variability across states

title: Divorce and FBI Crime Data Analysis
text:
Overview
This project provides a Python package for exploring FBI crime data and divorce statistics by state.
It includes a Streamlit app for interactive visualization and tools for data wrangling.
Key features:

Load and clean FBI crime and divorce data
Visualize crime trends over time
Compare crime vs divorce rates
Interactive dashboard via Streamlit




Installation
You can install the package from PyPI:
pip install stat386-finalproject-divorce-crime



Run
You can run the streamlit app by running this in the terminal:
streamlit run src/stat386_finalproject_divorce_crime/app.py



Interacting with Data
On the left sidebar of the streamlit app, there are a couple drop downs. Select a state from the state dropdown to compare different states.
Select the crime you wish to see.
Select whether to look at actual data (i.e. number of homicides) vs rates of crime per capita
After making your selection, streamlit will automatically make the necessary adjustments to the graph.



Functions

load_data(file_name:str | Path) -> pd.DataFrame : this function takes in a string or path object as a parameter, and returns the corresponding datafile at that file location. You may need to play with the relative pathing. Data files will be located in Stat386-FinalProject-Divorce-Crime/src/data/*
